<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/10/musk-sues-alameda-county-threatens-leave-california-lockdowns?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Musk Wants to Ditch Tacos for Brisket
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Telsla Fremont plant" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84ODQvdGVsc2xhX2ZyZW1vbnRfcGxhbnQuanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Tesla</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The debate over reopening the economy has reached Act II, with none other than Elon Musk as the lead character.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Saturday, Musk's Tesla <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/05/09/tesla-sues-alameda-county-to-force-california-factory-reopening/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sued</a> California’s Alameda County for prohibiting the automaker from restarting manufacturing operations at its plant in Fremont. Tesla had been <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/08/tesla-fremont-plant-to-resume-limited-operations-friday.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">preparing</a> to get the assembly lines running again Friday, but the county said the company “must not reopen” due to local restrictions on nonessential businesses.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Telling Elon Musk he can’t go to work is like telling Miguel he can’t play guitar. On Twitter earlier Saturday, Musk called the county’s order the “<a href="https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1259162367285317633?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">final straw</a>.” He threatened to move Tesla’s HQ "and future programs to Texas/Nevada immediately,” while the status of its Fremont plant will depend "on how Tesla is treated in the future.” </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">That opened a can of worms</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One California politician <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2020/may/10/elon-musk-democrat-rebukes-magnate-tesla-hq-california?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">attacked Musk</a> with language not fit for a PG-13 newsletter<a href="https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2020/may/10/elon-musk-democrat-rebukes-magnate-tesla-hq-california?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"></a>, but others <a href="http://www.fremont.gov/CivicAlerts.aspx?AID=1768&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">defended</a> his calls to restart production. Fremont Mayor Lily Mei said she was “growing concerned about the potential implications for our regional economy” under lockdown orders, and assured Musk the city is “prepared to support Tesla as soon as they are able to resume automobile manufacturing operations.” Translation: This is not my call; please don’t go anywhere.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Down in Austin, lawmakers were putting the Shiner Bock on ice. Sen. Ted Cruz </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/tedcruz/status/1259251832385417217?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">retweeted Musk</a></span><span>, saying “We would welcome Tesla HQ in Texas...We make lots of cars & trucks in Texas, and we’d love more!!”  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Tesla’s Fremont, CA, factory is considered the crown jewel of its global manufacturing operations. It employs more than 10,000 people and is the only U.S. facility producing the Model S, Y, and 3. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The even bigger picture</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Tesla episode highlights the growing tensions between those who think businesses can reopen safely (Tesla said its restart plan followed months of “careful planning and preparation”), and officials who argue a hasty easing of restrictions will reverse progress in reducing the spread of the virus.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/10/stock-market-rises-along-historic-unemployment?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What’s Up With the Stock Market?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Two things happened on Friday:</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The U.S. unemployment rate jumped to 14.7% and data showed 20.5 million jobs were lost in April.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Dow, S&P, and Nasdaq all rose more than 1.5%. The Nasdaq even turned positive for the year.</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So...what’s up with the stock market? Here are a few theories:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">An effective government response. </strong>Early action by the Fed to provide liquidity <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2020-05-06/five-things-you-need-to-know-to-start-your-day?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">prevented a financial crisis</a> in the corporate sector. Meanwhile, Congress sent checks to the majority of working Americans and provided $670 billion in forgivable loans to small businesses. Many experts think more relief is needed, but obviously investors are satisfied, so far. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The stock market = lots of Big Tech. </strong>Microsoft, Amazon, Alphabet, Apple, and Facebook account for more than 20% of the S&P’s total value. As <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/01/whats-next-big-tech?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">we noted</a>, those firms are likely to emerge from the crisis relatively unscathed. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Corporate earnings </strong>for the last quarter weren’t as bad as feared.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Finally, </strong>investors could be wrong, and we’ll look at this story in a month and shake our heads.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/10/coronavirus-conspiracy-theorists-find-audience-youtube-facebook-amazon?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Coronavirus Conspiracy Theorists’ Weapons of Choice
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Are YouTube, Facebook, and Amazon—<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/09/technology/plandemic-judy-mikovitz-coronavirus-disinformation.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Dr. Peter Hotez’s words</a>, not ours. Hotez, the dean of the National School of Tropical Medicine at Baylor College of Medicine, was responding to a video that went viral last week, in which discredited scientist Dr. Judy Mikovits made false claims about the coronavirus. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In the video, an extended trailer for a film called </span><span><em>Plandemic</em></span><span>, Mikovits spreads dangerous health misinformation and claims that figures such as Bill Gates and Dr. Anthony Fauci pushed pandemic messaging to grab power.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The video racked up 1.8 million views, 17,000 comments, and almost 150,000 shares on Facebook before it was removed on Thursday. YouTube also removed the video, but Twitter did not—instead marking some links as "unsafe."</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Mikovits’s book, </span><span><em>Plague of Corruption</em></span><span>, leapt to the top of Amazon’s print bestseller list last week. Amazon says the book does not violate its content policies.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">We really hope we don’t have to say this, but...</strong>the only thing Dr. Fauci and Bill Gates are conspiring on is how to pull off the bespectacled turtle look.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/10/disneyland-shanghai-reopens-sold-crowds?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pandemic No Match for Cotton Candy
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Disney castle" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84MzIvZGlzbmV5X2Nhc3RsZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let’s be honest: We’re all a bit more frazzled than usual...which may be why many people are seizing opportunities to blow off steam on a 1,000-foot ship or at a Disney park. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Shanghai Disneyland reopened today</strong> after closing in late January. There <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/05/08/852661423/shanghai-disneyland-sells-out-of-tickets-for-post-shutdown-reopening?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will be major adjustments</a>—guests have to wear masks at all times except when eating, social distancing will be enforced in lines, restaurants, and rides, and some typically crowded experiences will remain closed. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But...it’s not staring at your wall, and it’ll be open, so people are clamoring for tickets. As of this weekend, the first two days were already sold out. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>This is a crucial test for Disney, which last quarter </span><span><a href="https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/business/story/2020-05-05/disney-earnings-heres-how-much-coronavirus-has-hurt-so-far?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lost $1 billion</a></span><span> due to COVID-19 in its highly profitable parks segment. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Cruises are in high demand, too. </strong>In the three days following Carnival's announcement that it'll resume some trips in August, a booking company told TMZ it saw a 600% increase in volume compared to the three days before the announcement. That's also a <a href="https://www.tmz.com/2020/05/09/carnival-bookings-spike-increase-cruises-resuming-august/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">200% increase</a> over the same period last year. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/10/pandemic-brings-cord-cutting-waste-spike?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Two Biz Stats That Make You Go…“Huh. Makes Sense.”

</h1>
</td>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">15–25%: </strong>The increase in the weight of residential waste since lockdown orders went into effect, Waste Management’s CFO <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/waste-management-wants-consumers-to-pay-more-as-it-moves-more-trash-11589115601?mod=hp_listb_pos5&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the WSJ</a>. Conversely, commercial and industrial waste weight dropped 16%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1.8 million: </strong>The number of pay-TV subscribers lost in Q1, the sector's worst quarter on record, per MoffettNathanson. Why more cord-cutting than usual? A) no live sports and b) commercial customers like bars and hotels have paused service. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here's a great thought starter, per our friends at <a href="https://twitter.com/awfulannouncing/status/1257672912217104384?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Awful Announcing</a>:</p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nAUTO\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/10/musk-sues-alameda-county-threatens-leave-california-lockdowns?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nMusk Wants to Ditch Tacos for Brisket\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Telsla Fremont plant\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84ODQvdGVsc2xhX2ZyZW1vbnRfcGxhbnQuanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eTesla\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe debate over reopening the economy has reached Act II, with none other than Elon Musk as the lead character.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Saturday, Musk's Tesla \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/05/09/tesla-sues-alameda-county-to-force-california-factory-reopening/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esued\u003c/a\u003e California’s Alameda County for prohibiting the automaker from restarting manufacturing operations at its plant in Fremont. Tesla had been \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/08/tesla-fremont-plant-to-resume-limited-operations-friday.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epreparing\u003c/a\u003e to get the assembly lines running again Friday, but the county said the company “must not reopen” due to local restrictions on nonessential businesses.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTelling Elon Musk he can’t go to work is like telling Miguel he can’t play guitar. On Twitter earlier Saturday, Musk called the county’s order the “\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1259162367285317633?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efinal straw\u003c/a\u003e.” He threatened to move Tesla’s HQ \"and future programs to Texas/Nevada immediately,” while the status of its Fremont plant will depend \"on how Tesla is treated in the future.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThat opened a can of worms\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne California politician \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2020/may/10/elon-musk-democrat-rebukes-magnate-tesla-hq-california?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eattacked Musk\u003c/a\u003e with language not fit for a PG-13 newsletter\u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2020/may/10/elon-musk-democrat-rebukes-magnate-tesla-hq-california?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, but others \u003ca href=\"http://www.fremont.gov/CivicAlerts.aspx?AID=1768\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edefended\u003c/a\u003e his calls to restart production. Fremont Mayor Lily Mei said she was “growing concerned about the potential implications for our regional economy” under lockdown orders, and assured Musk the city is “prepared to support Tesla as soon as they are able to resume automobile manufacturing operations.” Translation: This is not my call; please don’t go anywhere.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eDown in Austin, lawmakers were putting the Shiner Bock on ice. Sen. Ted Cruz \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/tedcruz/status/1259251832385417217?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eretweeted Musk\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, saying “We would welcome Tesla HQ in Texas...We make lots of cars \u0026 trucks in Texas, and we’d love more!!”  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eTesla’s Fremont, CA, factory is considered the crown jewel of its global manufacturing operations. It employs more than 10,000 people and is the only U.S. facility producing the Model S, Y, and 3. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe even bigger picture\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Tesla episode highlights the growing tensions between those who think businesses can reopen safely (Tesla said its restart plan followed months of “careful planning and preparation”), and officials who argue a hasty easing of restrictions will reverse progress in reducing the spread of the virus.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nWhat’s Up With the Stock Market?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTwo things happened on Friday:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe U.S. unemployment rate jumped to 14.7% and data showed 20.5 million jobs were lost in April.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Dow, S\u0026P, and Nasdaq all rose more than 1.5%. The Nasdaq even turned positive for the year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo...what’s up with the stock market? Here are a few theories:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAn effective government response. \u003c/strong\u003eEarly action by the Fed to provide liquidity \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2020-05-06/five-things-you-need-to-know-to-start-your-day?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprevented a financial crisis\u003c/a\u003e in the corporate sector. Meanwhile, Congress sent checks to the majority of working Americans and provided $670 billion in forgivable loans to small businesses. Many experts think more relief is needed, but obviously investors are satisfied, so far. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe stock market = lots of Big Tech. \u003c/strong\u003eMicrosoft, Amazon, Alphabet, Apple, and Facebook account for more than 20% of the S\u0026P’s total value. As \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/01/whats-next-big-tech?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewe noted\u003c/a\u003e, those firms are likely to emerge from the crisis relatively unscathed. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCorporate earnings \u003c/strong\u003efor the last quarter weren’t as bad as feared.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFinally, \u003c/strong\u003einvestors could be wrong, and we’ll look at this story in a month and shake our heads.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAre YouTube, Facebook, and Amazon—\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/09/technology/plandemic-judy-mikovitz-coronavirus-disinformation.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eDr. Peter Hotez’s words\u003c/a\u003e, not ours. Hotez, the dean of the National School of Tropical Medicine at Baylor College of Medicine, was responding to a video that went viral last week, in which discredited scientist Dr. Judy Mikovits made false claims about the coronavirus. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn the video, an extended trailer for a film called \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ePlandemic\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, Mikovits spreads dangerous health misinformation and claims that figures such as Bill Gates and Dr. Anthony Fauci pushed pandemic messaging to grab power.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe video racked up 1.8 million views, 17,000 comments, and almost 150,000 shares on Facebook before it was removed on Thursday. YouTube also removed the video, but Twitter did not—instead marking some links as \"unsafe.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMikovits’s book, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ePlague of Corruption\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, leapt to the top of Amazon’s print bestseller list last week. Amazon says the book does not violate its content policies.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWe really hope we don’t have to say this, but...\u003c/strong\u003ethe only thing Dr. Fauci and Bill Gates are conspiring on is how to pull off the bespectacled turtle look.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eShanghai Disneyland reopened today\u003c/strong\u003e after closing in late January. There \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/05/08/852661423/shanghai-disneyland-sells-out-of-tickets-for-post-shutdown-reopening?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill be major adjustments\u003c/a\u003e—guests have to wear masks at all times except when eating, social distancing will be enforced in lines, restaurants, and rides, and some typically crowded experiences will remain closed. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut...it’s not staring at your wall, and it’ll be open, so people are clamoring for tickets. As of this weekend, the first two days were already sold out. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThis is a crucial test for Disney, which last quarter \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/business/story/2020-05-05/disney-earnings-heres-how-much-coronavirus-has-hurt-so-far?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elost $1 billion\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e due to COVID-19 in its highly profitable parks segment. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCruises are in high demand, too. \u003c/strong\u003eIn the three days following Carnival's announcement that it'll resume some trips in August, a booking company told TMZ it saw a 600% increase in volume compared to the three days before the announcement. That's also a \u003ca href=\"https://www.tmz.com/2020/05/09/carnival-bookings-spike-increase-cruises-resuming-august/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e200% increase\u003c/a\u003e over the same period last year. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F05%2F10%2Fdisneyland-shanghai-reopens-sold-crowds\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
